clinical_study.brief_title: Digital Sedation: Virtual Reality Hypnosis During Colonoscopy
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Randomized Controlled Monocentric Study Comparing Digital Sedation Versus Intravenous Sedation Among Patients Undergoing Colonoscopy

brief_summary.textblock: This prospective Randomized Controlled Trial will evaluate efficacy, safety, and pharmacoeconomic outcomes in patients undergoing colonoscopy with either Digital Sedation using the Aqua© module of the Oncomfort device (Sedakit TM) or the standard of care, intravenous sedation with propofol. The Aqua© module is designed for sedation and management of pain and anxiety related to medical and surgical procedures.

detailed_description.textblock:
This prospective Randomized Controlled Trial will evaluate efficacy, safety, and pharmacoeconomic outcomes in patients undergoing colonoscopy with either Digital Sedation using the Aqua© module of the Oncomfort device (Sedakit TM) or the standard of care, intravenous sedation with propofol. The Aqua© module is designed for sedation and management of pain and anxiety related to medical and surgical procedures.
Participants will be recruited during the anesthesiology consultation conducted in preparation for colonoscopy. Those with indication for screening or diagnostic colonoscopy under conventional intravenous sedation (propofol) and willing to participate will provide their written informed consent and will be randomized (2:1) between two arms:
1. Experimental arm: Digital Sedation, with rescue intravenous sedation (propofol) if needed upon patient request
2. Control arm: conventional intravenous sedation (propofol)
The study will be divided into two stages, with randomization (2:1) maintained throughout. In the first stage, accrual will be halted when about 45 patients have been randomized, at least 27 of whom being evaluable patients randomized to the experimental arm. A non-binding futility analysis is planned for the primary outcome. If the milestones are met, accrual will be reopened to the second stage and the study will continue to the planned final accrual of 177 patients (118 to experimental and 59 to control arm, respectively). At the end of the recruitment of Stage 1, an analysis of the secondary outcomes will also be run. Results of these analysis could also impact the decision for pursuing to second stage.

primary_outcome.measure: To confirm the feasibility of using digital sedation in colonoscopy (stage 1)
primary_outcome.description: cecal intubation rate, rate of rescue sedation

primary_outcome.measure: To demonstrate adequate performance of colonoscopy using digital sedation (stage 2)
primary_outcome.description: cecal intubation rate, rate of rescue sedation

secondary_outcome.measure: To compare patient experience in both arms
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of satisfaction by Likert scale (0 to 5), pain by Visual Analogue Scale (VAS 0 to 10), anxiety by Visual Analogue Scale (VAS 0 to 10), comfort by Visual Analogue Scale (VAS 0 to 10), Preferred type of sedation, Recall of the procedure, Experienced side effects/ AE

secondary_outcome.measure: To compare measures of colonoscopy performance in both arms
secondary_outcome.description: Compare Cecal intubation rates, Adenoma detection rates, Withdrawal time,Total duration of colonoscopy, Total duration of sedation,Total length of stay in procedure room,Total length of stay in recovery room,Total length of stay in hospital

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess the need for rescue sedation in the experimental arm
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with cecal intubation without rescue sedation in the experimental arm, Frequency of use of intravenous sedation (propofol) and of complete interruption of digital sedation

secondary_outcome.measure: To compare use of sedation medication in both arms
secondary_outcome.description: Average (per patient) total doses of sedation medication per arm

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess gastroenterologist and anesthesiologist satisfaction in both arms
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of satisfaction by Likert scale (0 to 5) and of perceived facilitation or impediment of the procedure by Digital Sedation as measured by Likert scale (0 to 5)

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess gastroenterologist and anesthesiologist stress in both arms
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of stress by Visual Analogue Scale (VAS 0 to 10)

secondary_outcome.measure: To compare physiologic measures in both arms
secondary_outcome.description: Oxygen saturation (minimal observed during procedure), MBP (min/max.), Heart rate (min/max)

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess difficulty or ease of the procedure in both arms
secondary_outcome.description: Number of abdominal manipulations and patient mobilizations

secondary_outcome.measure: To compare the safety in both arms
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency and type of AEs and SAEs, Frequency and severity of episodes of desaturation and of HR/ MBP changes

arm_group.description: Digital Sedation with rescue intravenous sedation (propofol) if needed upon patient request
Control arm with conventional Intravenous sedation

intervention.description: Digital Sedation session consists in a virtual reality software (Aqua© 30 Version 3.0, Oncomfort SA, Waver, Belgium) including a clinical hypnosis script.Patients in the intervention group will undergo a 30-minute Digital Sedation program through a VR headset and headphones connected to a mobile phone (Galaxy S8, Samsung, Seoul, Korea). This medical device called Oncomfort SedakitTM has been created to reduce anxiety and pain during medical/ surgical interventions

Standard sedation starting doses of 2 µg/ml to 6 µg/ml depending on patient's reaction and titrated incrementally by 0.5µg/ml. Doses are adapted according to the level of comfort and needs of the patient.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age of 18 years or older
- Indication for screening or diagnostic colonoscopy under conventional IVS (propofol)
- Provision of written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of difficult prior colonoscopy
- Low auditory acuity that precludes use of the device
- Low visual acuity that precludes use of the device
- Head or face wounds precluding use of the device
- Schizophrenia
- Dizziness
- Water/sea phobia
- Non-proficiency in French or Dutch (research language)
